input_text:
Job Title: Account Executive, Federal Sales

Location: Providence, RI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Be unstoppable with us!

T-Mobile is synonymous with innovation–and you could be part of the team that disrupted an entire industry! We reinvented customer service, brought real 5G to the nation, and now we’re shaping the future of technology in wireless and beyond. Our work is as exciting as it is rewarding, so consider the career opportunity below as your invitation to grow with us, make big things happen with us, above all, #BEYOU with us. Together, we won’t stop!


Job Overview

The Account Executive, Federal sells products and services to highly sensitive federal (Civilian or DoD) accounts with a focus on small town rural 5G federal government institutions. They leverage experience in handling large and complex accounts and work directly with clients at the senior management level, developing profitable new business account relationships. They devote a substantial amount of time in direct, face-to-face contact with prospective clients, exercise a high level of judgment and decision-making authority to generate significant growth in the federal business segment.

Job Responsibilities:

Develops profitable new account relationships in the Department of Defense (DOD)/Federal Civilian vertical.Travels regularly to assigned military bases within a territory to meet with existing and prospective clients (up to 40% travel monthly)Drives new business through partnerships with external sales/cold calling efforts.Identifies and solicits business opportunities based on knowledge of clients, markets, products, and services.Makes sales presentations to current and prospective DOD/Federal Civilian clients.Documents sales activities using our CRM platform to organize territory.Implements and maintains an effective referral network and call program to promote sales.Collaborates with internal partners within Government and throughout the enterprise to build a successful network of internal advocates to support continuity and growth within the Public Sector.Establishes and maintains positive public relationships within the community to enhance the organization's image and promote new business.Education:High School Diploma/GED (Required)Bachelor's Degree (Preferred)Work Experience:2-4 years Sales experience in an acquisition capacity (Required)Less than 2 years Previous sales/relationship management and RFPs/RFQs within the Federal space. Experience in managing complex corporate and/or government RFPs. (Preferred)Less than 2 years Experience selling postpaid products within a Federal vertical is a plus. (Preferred)Less than 2 years Wireless industry or technical sales experience. (Preferred)Less than 2 years Business markets sales experience. (Preferred)Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Technical Sales Advanced knowledge of sales and sales strategies, strong negotiation and decision-making skills (Required)Customer Satisfaction Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects and deadlines simultaneously to build and maintain client trust and satisfaction (Required)Communication Excellent interpersonal, presentation, verbal, and written communication skills (Required)Presentations Excellent marketing and business development/sales skills (Required)Problem Solving Ability to creatively resolve complex problems with general guidance (Required)Cross Functional Team Building Experience partnering with team members and building cross-functional professional relationships (Required)Microsoft Excel (Preferred)Licenses and Certifications: At least 18 years of age Legally authorized to work in the United States T-Mobile requires U.S. citizenship for certain roles within the organization. This role requires U.S. citizenship. Individuals hired into this role will be required to submit documentation proving U.S. citizenship within the first 7 days of hire - failure to do so will result in termination.


Travel:

Travel Required (Yes/No):Yes

DOT Regulated:

DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No):No

Safety Sensitive Position (Yes/No):No

At T-Mobile, our benefits exemplify the spirit of One Team, Together! A big part of how we care for one another is working to ensure our benefits evolve to meet the needs of our team members. Full and part-time employees have access to the same benefits when eligible. We cover all of the bases, offering medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, 401(k), employee stock grants, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and up to paid 12 holidays - which total about 4 weeks for new full-time employees and about 2.5 weeks for new part-time employees annually - paid parental and family leave, family building benefits, back-up care, enhanced family support, childcare subsidy, tuition assistance, college coaching, short and long term disability, voluntary AD&D coverage, voluntary accident coverage, voluntary life insurance, voluntary disability insurance, and voluntary long-term care insurance.

We don't stop there- eligible employees can receive mobile service & home internet discounts, pet insurance, and access to commuter and transit programs! To learn about T-Mobile’s amazing benefits, check out www.t-mobilebenefits.com. 

Never stop growing!

T-Mobile doesn’t have a corporate ladder–it’s more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it’s that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward.

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.

Talent comes in all forms at the Un-carrier. If you are an individual with a disability and need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing ApplicantAccommodation@t-mobile.com or calling 1-844-873-9500. Please note, this contact channel is not a means to apply for or inquire about a position and we are unable to respond to non-accommodation related requests.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Account Executive, Federal Sales
output_json.summary: An Account Executive role at T-Mobile focusing on selling products and services to federal government institutions.
job_responsibilities: Develops profitable new account relationships in the Department of Defense (DOD)/Federal Civilian vertical.
Travels regularly to assigned military bases within a territory to meet with existing and prospective clients.
Drives new business through partnerships with external sales/cold calling efforts.
Identifies and solicits business opportunities based on knowledge of clients, markets, products, and services.
Makes sales presentations to current and prospective DOD/Federal Civilian clients.
Documents sales activities using our CRM platform to organize territory.
Implements and maintains an effective referral network and call program to promote sales.
Collaborates with internal partners within Government and throughout the enterprise to build a successful network of internal advocates to support continuity and growth within the Public Sector.
Establishes and maintains positive public relationships within the community to enhance the organization's image and promote new business.
output_json.company_information: T-Mobile is a leading provider of wireless services and technology, known for disrupting the industry with innovative solutions.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.
